page.title: 13Ecology in Barrhead
page.content: In the area{animals}such as rabbits, foxes and deer are found. Smaller creataures such as shrews, moles and mice are quite common. Blackbirds, magpies, wrens, pigeons, robins, owls, tits and chaffinches are some of the birds found here. Beech, oak, chestnut, rowan and conifers are common and are found in and around the town. Common wild {plants}are dandelion, buttercup, foxgrove, nettle and dog rose. Smokeless fuel has helped to keep the air cleaner, but the River Levern still suffers from{pollution}from local works. The{climate}in the area is damp with a rainfall of 1250 mm. The winters are cold, wet and occasionally snowy.
